xml.p: Introduction: "Hmmph... It's irritating to have to meet all these new people, huh?#$b#Name's George, by the way. Now buzz off... Hmmph." #!String

accept_867: "What's this?#$b#Hmmph... so you push this button first? What's this button do? Hmmph... *grumble*#$b#Hehe! Well, how about that! It's a new channel!$h#$b#Here, take this. It's a stone I found when I was a coal miner back in the day. Funny thing, it's glowed blue and stayed cold for over forty years. Like magic!" #!String
pamHouseUpgrade: "Thanks for replacing that beat up old trailer... the new house is much nicer to look at.#$e#You know, I'll bet it increases the value of our property too!" #!String
pamHouseUpgradeAnonymous: "Welp... that new house blocks my view of the river a little... but it sure looks nicer than that old tin can Pam was livin' in." #!String
MovieInvitation: "You wanna see a movie with an old geezer like me? ...Well... okay. I'll meet you there." #!String
joja_Begin: "So... the old Community Center is gone, huh? Whatever happened to small-town values? It's a shame how times have changed..." #!String
Mon: "I'm not much of a talker. Especially not to strangers, if you don't mind me saying." #!String
Tue: "Hmmph... Looks like another gloomy day.$s" #!String
Wed: "Alex is my grandson. Have I told you that already?#$e#Huh? Speak up." #!String

Wed_inlaw_Alex: "How can two men get married? It's unnatural... Hmmph. I guess I'm just \"old fashioned\"...^You're part of the family, now. I'm glad that my grandson found such a nice wife." #!String

Wed10_inlaw_Alex: "I'll admit, I thought it was... strange... for two men to be together. But you're such a nice young man, and I know you two are in love... I've changed my mind.^You're part of the family, now... and I couldn't be more proud." #!String
Thu: "I can't talk right now, young man.^I can't talk right now, miss.#$e#My favorite program is on." #!String
Fri: "So you're a farmer, huh? At least it's honest work." #!String
Sat: "The weekend is no different than any other time, for me.#$e#That's how it is when you're retired." #!String
Sun: "Aren't you cold? They don't make sweaters like they used to.#$e#*Sigh*" #!String
Mon6: "I'm surprised you want to be friends with an old-timer like me." #!String
Thu6: "Hello, @. Wanna watch the TV with me?" #!String
Fri4: "My grand-pap was a farmer. It's a respectable profession.#$e#If I wasn't so darned old I'd come to your farm and show you a thing or two..." #!String
Wed8: "I wish my legs worked so I could play catch with Alex.$s#$e#That'll never happen.$s" #!String
Fri8: "I've been thinking...Maybe I've been a little bit of a grouch.$s#$e#I used to think no one cared about us old folks." #!String
Fri10: "You know, I really have been a grumpy old man to everyone. But now I feel like I'm softening up like an old ripe fruit. Hehe!$h#$e#Take care, son.^Take care, hun." #!String
Wed10: "@! Let me turn off this darned television and we can have a little chat.$h#$e#So what are the young people doing these days?" #!String
Tue10: "You know, I shouldn't get too depressed about my legs.#$e#I should just be happy that I'm alive.$h" #!String
Thu10: "When you get as old as me it's a lot harder to adjust to new things.#$e#One day you'll know what I mean.#$e#Go on, enjoy yourself while you're still young." #!String
winter_1: "Ohh... It's so cold.#$e#When you're young the cold doesn't bite as hard." #!String
